predictions.text: U.S. CPI-U headline year-over-year for August 2025 will be between 2.7% and 3.1%, as reported by BLS on 2025-09-11.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the 12-month percent change in CPI-U (all items, U.S. city average) in the BLS CPI news release on 2025-09-11 falls within 2.7%–3.1% inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Cleveland Fed CPI nowcast updates
Gasoline prices and AAA daily data
Shelter/rent trackers (Zillow, Apartment List) momentum
Used car auction prices (Manheim index) and food commodities
predictions.rationale: Softening demand and moderate recent monthly prints suggest y/y stays near 3%, with shelter the main upside risk.

predictions.text: At the September 2025 FOMC meeting (decision expected 2025-09-17), the Fed will cut the target range for the federal funds rate by 25 bp to 4.75%–5.00%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the target range specified in the Federal Reserve FOMC statement on 2025-09-17 is 4.75%–5.00%.
monitoring_signals: CME FedWatch probability path into meeting
CPI/PPI prints and revisions pre-meeting
Labor data (claims, JOLTS, payrolls) and ISM surveys
Fedspeak and SEP projections reporting
predictions.rationale: Cooling growth and moderate inflation argue for easing, but uncertainty on inflation stickiness likely keeps the Fed at 25 bp rather than 50.

predictions.text: The U.S. 2-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS2) will close at or below 3.95% on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any daily close for FRED series DGS2 on or before 2025-10-31 is ≤ 3.95%.
monitoring_signals: Fed policy path repricing (Fed funds futures, OIS)
CPI/PPI/core PCE outcomes vs expectations
Jobless claims trend and unemployment rate
Treasury auction demand, bid-to-cover, and term premium estimates
predictions.rationale: Front-end yields are sensitive to near-term policy. Softer growth + disinflation should pull the 2-year lower at least briefly.

predictions.text: From 2025-09-09 close to 2025-10-15 close, Robinhood Markets (HOOD) will outperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) by at least 6.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Yahoo Finance adjusted close data for HOOD and SPY: compute percentage change from 2025-09-09 close to 2025-10-15 close. Outcome is true if HOOD% − SPY% ≥ 6.0 ppt.
monitoring_signals: Index inclusion effective date flows and passive fund buys
Short interest, borrow rates, and days-to-cover
Options skew/volume and realized volatility
Retail trading activity metrics and revenue catalysts
predictions.rationale: S&P 500 inclusion typically catalyzes passive inflows and visibility. Near-term technicals and positioning can amplify relative outperformance.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31 (UTC), the AWS Service Health Dashboard will post at least one public incident citing subsea cable disruption in the Red Sea/Suez/Gulf of Aden region causing connectivity degradation or traffic rerouting.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check status.aws.amazon.com (or official AWS status history). Any incident within the window explicitly referencing subsea cable issues in Red Sea/Suez/Gulf of Aden that impacts connectivity/latency/rerouting qualifies.
monitoring_signals: Kentik/ThousandEyes telemetry showing reroutes via Middle East
Submarine cable outage reports (SubTel Forum, Cloudflare Radar)
Regional geopolitical disruptions affecting cable security
Other cloud providers’ status pages indicating correlated cable events
predictions.rationale: Regional cable damage has recurred in 2024–2025; large providers periodically report impact. Another incident in peak traffic periods is plausible.

predictions.text: For the week ending 2025-09-20, EIA will report a U.S. motor gasoline inventory build of at least 1.5 million barrels in the Weekly Petroleum Status Report released on 2025-09-25.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in EIA’s Weekly Petroleum Status Report on 2025-09-25 that total motor gasoline ending stocks increased by ≥ 1.5 million barrels versus the prior week.
monitoring_signals: Refinery utilization rates and planned maintenance schedules
Product supplied (implied demand) for gasoline
Gasoline imports/exports and PADD-level shifts
Retail gasoline prices and blending component inventories
predictions.rationale: Shoulder-season demand typically eases post-Labor Day while refinery runs remain elevated, favoring near-term inventory builds.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the U.S. Treasury’s OFAC will announce at least one new sanctions designation targeting Iranian defense, missile, or UAV sector entities or individuals via a public press release or sanctions list update.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm at least one OFAC action posted on home.treasury.gov adds Iranian defense/missile/UAV-related targets to the SDN or related lists within the window.
monitoring_signals: DoD/State briefings on Iranian arms transfers
Regional escalation incidents and UN/think-tank reporting
Prior OFAC cadence and thematic designations
Congressional or allied sanctions announcements
predictions.rationale: OFAC regularly targets Iran’s UAV/missile network; continued regional tensions and proliferation risks support further listings.

predictions.text: The Nikkei 225 (N225) will close at or above 44,500 on at least one trading day by 2025-10-15 (Tokyo time).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use official close data for the Nikkei 225 (ticker ^N225 on major data vendors). Outcome is true if any daily close through 2025-10-15 is ≥ 44,500.
monitoring_signals: USD/JPY level and BoJ communications
Global semiconductor/electronics sector performance
Japan earnings revisions and buyback announcements
Foreign investor flows into Japanese equities
predictions.rationale: A weak yen, tech momentum, and supportive domestic policy backdrop favor new highs after the index crossed 44,000.

predictions.text: NYMEX Henry Hub front-month natural gas futures will settle at or above $3.40 per MMBtu on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any official CME/NYMEX front-month Henry Hub daily settlement price through 2025-10-31 is ≥ $3.40/MMBtu.
monitoring_signals: EIA weekly storage injections vs 5-year norm
NOAA temperature forecasts and HDD/CDD trends
Production/pipe maintenance and LNG feedgas flows
Gulf weather risks and storm-related shut-ins
predictions.rationale: Seasonal volatility, production swings, and LNG demand resumption can push prompt gas above $3.40 at least briefly.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS10) will close at or below 3.80% on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any daily close for FRED series DGS10 on or before 2025-10-31 is ≤ 3.80%.
monitoring_signals: Inflation data trajectory (CPI/PCE) and growth surprises
Term premium estimates and Treasury supply/auction metrics
Risk sentiment (equity drawdowns, credit spreads, VIX)
Fed guidance and balance sheet policy signals
predictions.rationale: Moderating inflation and growth risks, plus haven demand, can compress 10-year yields to the high-3s at least temporarily.
